text: Carl Kasell (; April 2, 1934 â€“ April 17, 2018) was an American radio personality. He was born in Goldsboro, North Carolina. He was best known as a newscaster for National Public Radio and later as the official judge and scorekeeper of the weekly news quiz show Wait Wait... Don't Tell Me! until his retirement in 2014. Kasell died on April 17, 2018 from complications of Alzheimer's disease in Potomac, Maryland at the age of 84.NPR Newscaster Carl Kasell Dies At 84, After A Lifelong Career On-Air ==References== ==Other websites== *NPR biography Category:1934 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Deaths from Alzheimer's disease Category:Disease-related deaths in Maryland Category:American radio personalities Category:American game show hosts Category:American autobiographers Category:Journalists from North Carolina
title: Carl Kasell
